intro: Genistella delphinensis, commonly known as the Delphinus broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
